meanings.definition: Causing or tending to cause agitation or excitement.
meanings.sent1: The loud music at the party was quite agitative for the guests.
meanings.sent2: The roller coaster ride was an agitative experience for the thrill-seekers.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy's antics were agitative but adorable.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like an agitative storm, stirring up emotions in everyone.
meanings.sent5: The suspenseful movie had an agitative effect on the audience.

meanings.definition: Arousing or provoking strong feelings or emotions.
meanings.sent1: The heartfelt speech was agitative and moved many to tears.
meanings.sent2: The tragic news was agitative, causing sorrow among the community.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected plot twist in the story was agitative yet captivating.
meanings.sent4: His passionate performance on stage was agitative, leaving the audience in awe.
meanings.sent5: The breathtaking sunset painted an agitative scene in the sky.
